xbeerelay
Class RelayManager

java.lang.Object
  xbeerelay.RelayManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
XbeeRelayManager
public abstract class RelayManager
extends java.lang.Object

This is the base class for all relay-managing classes.

Author:
Casey Worthington

Method Detail

addManagedRelay

public void addManagedRelay(Relay inRelay)
                     throws RelayException
Associates a relay with this manager.

Parameters:
inRelay - relay to associate
Throws:
RelayException

removeManagedRelay

public void removeManagedRelay(int inRelayNum)
Disassociates a relay from this manager.

Note that if the relay is not currently associated with this manager, nothing happens.

Parameters:
inRelayNum - number of relay to disassociate

addManagedRelays

public void addManagedRelays(Relay[] inRelays)
                      throws RelayException
Associates multiple relays with this manager.

Parameters:
inRelays - array of relays to associate
Throws:
RelayException

removeManagedRelays

public void removeManagedRelays(int[] inRelayNums)
Disassociates multiple relays with this manager.

Note that if any relay in the input is not currently associated with this manager, nothing happens.

Parameters:
inRelayNums - numbers of relays to disassociate

turnOn

public abstract void turnOn(int inRelayNumber)
                     throws RelayException
Turns on the specified relay.

Note that if that relay is already on, nothing happens.

Parameters:
inRelayNumber - relay number of relay to turn on
Throws:
RelayException - if relay number is invalid (not associated with this manager)

turnOff

public abstract void turnOff(int inRelayNumber)
                      throws RelayException
Turns off the specified relay.

Note that if that relay is already off, nothing happens.

Parameters:
inRelayNumbers - integers of relay numbers to turn on
Throws:
RelayException - if relay number is invalid (not associated with this manager)

            throws RelayException
Turns on the specified relays.

Parameters:
inRelayNumbers - relay numbers to turn on
Throws:
RelayException - if any relay number is invalid (not associated with this manager)

Turns off the specified relays.

getRelayStatus

public Relay.RelayStatus getRelayStatus(int inRelayNumber)
                                 throws RelayException
Gets the locally-stored status of the given relay number.

Note that this method does NOT do anything to query the relay or update its status. For that, see updateRelayStatus.

Parameters:
inRelayNumber - number of relay we are checking
Returns:
locally stored relay status
Throws:
RelayException - if relay number is invalid

updateRelayStatus

public abstract Relay.RelayStatus updateRelayStatus(int inRelayNumber)
                                             throws RelayException
Goes to source and actually updates the locally-stored status of the relay.

Parameters:
inRelayNumber - relay number of relay to update
Returns:
status of relay after update
Throws:
RelayException - if relay number is invalid

updateRelayStatus

public void updateRelayStatus(int[] inRelayNumbers)
                       throws RelayException
Goes to source and actually updates the locally-stored status of the relays.

Parameters:
inRelayNumbers - relay numbers of relays to update
Throws:
RelayException - if any relay number is invalid

getNumManagedRelays

public int getNumManagedRelays()
Gets the number of relays currently managed by this instance of RelayManager.

Returns:
the number of relays being managed

getManagedRelays

public java.util.Collection<Relay> getManagedRelays()
Gets a collection of the actual Relay objects currently being managed by this instance of RelayManager.

Returns:
collection of relays being managed
